title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 135.4 - Initial procedures by department upon revocation or suspension
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 135.4 - Initial procedures by department upon revocation or suspension

State Regulations
(a) Revocation or
suspension issued pursuant to section
510
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law. Upon the generation of an order of suspension or
revocation of a driver's license issued pursuant to section
510
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law, the department will review the motorist's driving
record to determine whether the motorist is eligible for issuance of a
restricted license pursuant to the provisions of this Part. If the motorist is
eligible, the order will be mailed to the motorist. If the motorist is not
eligible for a restricted license, the order will be mailed to the motorist
with an explanation of his/her ineligibility. (b) Revocation pursuant to section
318
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law. Upon the generation of an order of revocation of a
driver's license issued pursuant to section
318
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law, the department will not make a determination of
eligibility for a restricted license at that time, unless the revocation is
based upon a conviction of a violation of section
319
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law, but will mail to the motorist the revocation
order. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
135.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
